20110120020103.000|20110120020105.000|CC1|FRIENDLIEST FROGS, THE SANDIEST

20110120020111.000|20110120020113.000|CC1|WELCOME TO QUEENSLAND, THE      
20110120020113.000|20110120020128.000|CC1|SUNSHINIEST STATE.

20110120020133.000|20110120020135.000|CC1|GREAT BARRIER REEF, THE WORLD'S 
20110120020135.000|20110120020137.000|CC1|LARGEST LIVING ORGANISM.        
20110120020137.000|20110120020139.000|CC1|MY JOURNEY HUGS THE COAST.      
20110120020139.000|20110120020141.000|CC1|STARTING AT SURFERS PARADISE    
20110120020141.000|20110120020143.000|CC1|AND DIPPING INTO FRASER ISLAND, 
20110120020143.000|20110120020144.000|CC1|THE WHITSUNDAYS, MAGNETIC

20110120020151.000|20110120020153.000|CC1|TO DIVE FOR GIANT POTATO COD AT 
20110120020153.000|20110120020221.000|CC1|THE COD HOLE.

20110120020223.000|20110120020225.000|CC1|QUEENSLAND'S GOLD COAST. THE    
20110120020225.000|20110120020227.000|CC1|SURFERS FLOCKED HERE FOR ITS

20110120020811.000|20110120020813.000|CC1|BRUCE HIGHWAY. IT STRETCHES UP  
20110120020813.000|20110120020815.000|CC1|THE COAST 1,060 MILES FROM      
20110120020815.000|20110120020817.000|CC1|BRISBANE TO CAIRNS. AT HARVEY   
20110120020817.000|20110120020819.000|CC1|BAY, I CATCH THE FERRY TO       
20110120020819.000|20110120020821.000|CC1|FRASER ISLAND. FRASER IS THE    
20110120020821.000|20110120020823.000|CC1|WORLD'S LARGEST SANDBAR, BUT    
20110120020823.000|20110120020825.000|CC1|IT'S ALSO HOME TO RAINFORESTS

20110120020826.000|20110120020830.000|CC1|HEY! WILL YOU LOOK AT THIS      
20110120020830.000|20110120020834.000|CC1|PLACE? THIS IS GORGEOUS. THIS   
20110120020834.000|20110120020835.000|CC1|IS ONE OF, I THINK, 70          
20110120020835.000|20110120020837.000|CC1|FRESHWATER LAKES YOU CAN SWIM IN
20110120020837.000|20110120020841.000|CC1|HERE. LAKE McKENZIE IS KNOWN AS 
20110120020841.000|20110120020842.000|CC1|WINDOW LAKE BECAUSE THE WATER   
20110120020842.000|20110120020844.000|CC1|IS SO CLEAR. IT RISES DIRECTLY  
20110120020844.000|20110120020845.000|CC1|FROM THE WATER TABLE, AND YOU   
20110120020845.000|20110120020847.000|CC1|CAN SEE 50 FEET DOWN. THE LAKES 
20110120020847.000|20110120020849.000|CC1|ARE THE ONLY PLACES YOU CAN     
20110120020849.000|20110120020850.000|CC1|SWIM HERE AS THE SEA HAS STRONG 
20110120020850.000|20110120020852.000|CC1|CURRENTS AND IS INFESTED WITH   
20110120020852.000|20110120020853.000|CC1|TIGER SHARKS.

20110120020854.000|20110120020856.000|CC1|SAND, IT'S KIND OF TOUGH TO GET 
20110120020856.000|20110120020858.000|CC1|AROUND. YOU COULD WALK, BUT WHY

20110120021559.000|20110120021600.000|CC1|>> I'VE HAD SUCH A NICE
